title: Updated de (German) translation
body:

title: NLP backend / no root
body:
Why not making this as NLP backend instead of requiring root access?
https://github.com/microg/android_packages_apps_UnifiedNlp/blob/master/README.md

title: Unable to store the GPS data under Nougat + Systemless Root
body: It seems that FasterGPS is not able to store the chosen Continent/Region information under Nougat. You can repro this by setting the Continent and Region, and proceed to close the app, and restart it again.

title: have a root rights but not save config
body:
The first thing I want - I thank you for the easy to use interface.

But I have to say that on my device is not working properly. So what i`ll have
Device: HTC Wildfire S
OS: CyanogenMod 10.1 06.01.2015
Root-rights by: SuperSU 2.46
I am setting up your application by Googl App store. This download and setting up fine. I reboot my system after that.  In first run  apps wants to getting  roots-rights - and i`ll give it them  - in SuperSu app. FasterGPS process has th OK status. But when i am configured  in additional mode after closing the application - the setting upping settings are not saved and the file /syste/etc/gps.cong is empty. Restore did not work. 
After using the application appears  17KB cache files are nowhere seened. This can be seen in detail of the application menu. The log SuperSu of the program are displayed with a green status.

Could you fix it ?

title: Made GPS lock much slower; resolved by reverting changes
body:
I installed FasterGPS last year, likely when I was in Europe, in case that makes a difference (since geography does come into play here). I never noticed any problems. 

I've now been in the US the past few months, and within the past month or so noticed that the GPS on my LG Optimus F3 was taking an unusually long time to get a lock. The other night I decided to look into the issue and installed GPS Test. Running the test I saw that my GPS was only picking up one satellite, despite holding it for at least a minute up to a southern-facing window. 

I went into FasterGPS and restored the original configuration. Running the GPS test again in the same location, I picked up several satellites and got a GPS lock quickly. 

Per the suggestion on Google Play I'm leaving this here as a bug report instead of giving a bad review to try to help out.

title: Dont works with Kinguser su
body: Hello, app dont work with Kinguser app, this is sate app that SuperSU. Could you fix this?

title: Backed up gps.conf doesn't hash identically to original after restoration
body: The backup gps.conf is not identical to the original file.  This is evident during OTA updates (in my case 4.4.2 -> 4.4.3), where the update process fails due to a different checksum on the gps.conf restored by FasterGPS.

title: Crashes and hangs all the time on Nexus 4/Android 4.4.2
body:
Application seems to be crashing and hanging every time I try to use it.
Somehow I managed to get gps.conf written for the first time, but now when I try to use any from additional settings, I get app crash.

Typical scenario:
1) run FasterGPS
2) open Additional settings
3) click on INTERMADIATE_POS, enter value, press OK
4) **a message saying that root permissions been granted appears, then UI hangs deadly for about 20-40 seconds, then a system message saying that application doesn't respond Appears.**

title: Improve gps.conf settings
body:
User AngelDeath form the XDA forum provides extensively improved (= not only the NTP server address) and regionalized gps.conf files here : http://forum.xda-developers.com/showpost.php?p=11342772&postcount=1

Why not team up with him/her to allow FasterGPS to download and/or set AngelDeath's settings ?

title: Selecting Sweden crashes the app
body:
After I select Europe as my region and Sweden as my country of choice the app locks up for 10 seconds and crashes. 

If I select Denmark instead, the app doesn't lock up and successfully changes the NTP server.

title: Canadian NTP server is a Brazilian website hosted in Saudi Arabia?
body:
If I do a trace route to ca.pool.ntp.org, it goes to a Brazilian website for a personal trainer named "Carina Rosa". When I track the IP address, it appears to be in Saudi Arabia. What's up with that?

A tracert to the US server goes to an obvious NTP server in Berkeley, CA.

title: [1.11 (13)] Using FasterGPS without a data connection?
body:
Hello

I noticed that GPS is unavailable when travelling in cities in a foreign country with data roaming disabled.

GPS goes sometimes work when standing in a clear sky area for a while, but not when moving around cities.

I was told that FasterGPS requires a data connection since it polls NTP servers, so I should disable FasterGPS when no data connection is available and get an offline GPS reception.

What do you think? Is smartphone GPS useless with no data connection?

Thank you.

title: FasterGPS doesn't work on 4.4 KitKat
body:
The title says it all, 
The application starts, but when I select a specific location (timezone), it halts and then crashes (FC).

title: gps.conf - SUPL_TLS_HOST and SUPL_TLS_CERT variables
body:
I found in many sites the same optimized file (gps.conf) in thsi case for Italy

NTP_SERVER=it.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=0.it.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=1.it.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=2.it.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=3.it.pool.ntp.org
DEBUG_LEVEL =0
INTERMEDIATE_POS=0
ACCURACY_THRES=0
REPORT_POSITION_USE_SUPL_REFLOC=1
ENABLE_WIPER=1
XTRA_SERVER_1=http://xtra1.gpsonextra.net/xtra.bin
XTRA_SERVER_2=http://xtra2.gpsonextra.net/xtra.bin
XTRA_SERVER_3=http://xtra3.gpsonextra.net/xtra.bin
XTRA_SERVER_4=
XTRA_SERVER_5=
SUPL_NO_SECURE_PORT=3425
SUPL_PORT=7276
SUPL_HOST=supl.google.com
SUPL_SECURE_PORT=7275
C2K_HOST=c2k.pde.com
C2K_PORT=1234
DEFAULT_AGPS_ENABLE=TRUE
DEFAULT_SSL_ENABLE=FALSE
DEFAULT_USER_PLANE=TRUE
SUPL_TLS_HOST=FQDN
SUPL_TLS_CERT=/etc/SuplRootCert

As I explianed a previous request I found several NTP servers (with same string variable name - strange)

At the end of configuration file I found two variables that I didn't fin in the Faster GPS
app

SUPL_TLS_HOST=FQDN
SUPL_TLS_CERT=/etc/SuplRootCert

Which are the meaning of theese variables and why didn't are availble in Faster GPS?

title: Add more NTP server option
body:
Now is possible to open a single NTP server.

Please add amroe option for ntp server, like

NTP SERVER 1 / NTP SERVER 2 / NTP SERVER 3 / NTP SERVER 4 / NTP SERVER 5

In this way you can add a configuration like

NTP_SERVER=eu.pool.org
NTP_SERVER=0.europe.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=1.europe.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=2.europe.pool.ntp.org
NTP_SERVER=3.europe.pool.ntp.org

Thanks. Bye.

title: Xtra server lists are not in numeric order
body:
The lists of Xtra server in "Avdacced configuration" is 

Xtra server 5 / Xtra server 4 / Xtra server 1 / Xtra server 3 / Xtra server 2

I believe that should be 

Xtra server 1 / Xtra server 2 / Xtra server 3 / Xtra server 4 / Xtra server 5

Thanks. Bye.

title: alphabetical order of continents and countries in dropdown lists
body:
this is not an actual bug, just a suggestion
the title is pretty much self explanatory. right now the continents and countries are in random order, would be neat if it was alphabetical

title: Choice of continent/region: why not automatic?
body: Would it be possible to add an "Auto" setting that, when selected, would derive the nearest NTP server from Android's location service itself?

title: FasterGPS 1.8 force closes half of the time on 4.3
body:
While the 1.8 version now works with 4.3, it forces about half of the time when trying to write to gps.conf. A logcat says the following:

RootCommands: Error at org.fastergps.util.Utils.writeConfig(Utils.java:241)

RootCommands: Error at org.fastergps.ui.BaseActivity$5$1.onClick(BaseActivity.java:302)

title: gps.conf access broken by JB4.3
body: The new isolation of zygote processes from system mounts breaks gps.conf writing in the latest version.

title: Saving preferences between flashing ROMs.
label: [Label(name="Priority-Medium"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="imported")]
body: _Original author: daniele...@gmail.com (May 16, 2013 18:34:58)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. flashing a new nightly Cyanogenmod rom 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? the app doesn't seem to save the region preference between roms. not a big deal but new roms come out almost daily. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? v 1.6 (7) night Android roms Please provide any additional information below. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/faster-gps/issues/detail?id=21_

title: FEATURE: add a prefered setting, which will be checked at every boot
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
_Original author: ronny.bo...@googlemail.com (November 15, 2012 12:42:58)_

I am using the last version, one thing bothers me somewhat. I have to set after every flash of a new nightly my prefered settings (Europe/Germany). 

So my request is, that you may add a prefered values section somehow and do a check at every boot for this settings. If they are not set, then set it automatically. 

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/faster-gps/issues/detail?id=20_

title: satelites available but not locked
label: [Label(name="Priority-Medium"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="imported")]
body: _Original author: slaganje...@gmail.com (August 27, 2012 14:06:37)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.turn on gps 2.turn on google maps 3.wifi on, data transfer on, What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect to get correct location. Location was accurate in 2500m. Could not lock satelite even after 2 minutes. Such problem existed occasionally even before faster-gps was installed. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Faster-gps 1.4 (5) Motorola Defy+, Cyanogen mod 7.2 nightly, Android 2.3.7 Please provide any additional information below. When GPS status app was started, 8 satelites are visible in 15 seconds but none was locked even after 2 minutes. This is probably not a problem with your app but, it will not fix the speed in this case. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/faster-gps/issues/detail?id=18_

title: Not working on ICS 4.0.3 on galaxy s2/miui 2.8.10 (solution: install busybox)
label: [Label(name="Priority-Medium"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="imported")]
body: _Original author: adi...@gmail.com (June 09, 2012 14:21:31)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.open the app 2.select a specific continent and region 3.the message "gps.conf was written successfully, and at current server there is my selection. 4.exit and reenter the app and nothing is changed. at current server there is the previous selection. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? to change the ntp server to my selection. nothing changes What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? ICS 4.0.3 on galaxy s2 rooted of course. app v. 1.4(5) Please provide any additional information below. with other apps i manage to change the npt server. I really like the looks of yours and the multitude of npt servers. but i doesnt change the ntp server for me. So i must use a similar app and input the server manually. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/faster-gps/issues/detail?id=17_

title: GPS no longer locks
label: [Label(name="Priority-Medium"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="imported")]
body: _Original author: Jacob...@gmail.com (May 22, 2012 16:54:51)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. install faster-gps 2. set location (north america, united states) 3. attempt to use navigation or gps status What is the expected output? What do you see instead? get a lock on gps satellites, either instantly or after 15 minutes. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? current version of faster-gps. android 2.2.1 Please provide any additional information below. Hi Dom. Thanks for all your development work on Android. I have a rooted LG Optimus V running stock ROM. I recently installed the Faster-GPS app to see if I could improve my GPS lock time, which actually wasn't that bad to begin with. However, after loading the North America - United States location into Faster-GPS, I was no longer able to get a lock at all with my GPS. My accuracy is never better than 9800m. If I turn off 'Use wireless networks' under 'My Location', I can't get any kind of fix at all. In a different application, GPS Status, I don't get any locks on any satellites. I then tried to restore the original settings from Faster-GPS, but I am still not able to lock onto any satellites. A friend has the exact same phone, an LG Optimus V, not rooted. Side by side, he is able to lock on immediately, and can track at least 4, sometimes as many as 8 GPS satellites very quickly. Any ideas? Thanks again! _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/faster-gps/issues/detail?id=16_

title: Please add more NTP locations

body:

title: Cloning menus
label: [Label(name="Priority-Medium"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="imported")]
body: _Original author: Stefan.L...@gmail.com (February 28, 2012 22:16:44)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Enter advanced settings 2. Go back 3. You now have another copy of the menu, which doesn't work. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Should only be one copy of the menu. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Umm, latest version. Android 2.3.5 on Samsung galaxy s2 Please provide any additional information below. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/faster-gps/issues/detail?id=2_
